document.title: Montana K-12 Science Content Standards Framework

83555730DFE601311C3968A86D17958E.description: describe science as a human endeavor and an ongoing process

835513E0DFE601311C3868A86D17958E.description: describe how scientific inquiry has produced much knowledge about the world and a variety of contributions toward understanding events and phenomenon within the universe

8354D190DFE601311C3768A86D17958E.description: give historical examples of scientific and technological contributions to communities, cultures and societies, including Montana American Indian examples

83548CD0DFE601311C3668A86D17958E.description: Students understand historical developments in science and technology.

83544630DFE601311C3568A86D17958E.description: identify how the knowledge of science and technology influences the development of the Montana American Indian cultures

8353F610DFE601311C3468A86D17958E.description: use scientific knowledge to make inferences and propose solutions for simple environmental problems

8353B870DFE601311C3368A86D17958E.description: simulate scientific collaboration by sharing and communicating ideas to identify and describe problems

835375F0DFE601311C3268A86D17958E.description: describe a scientific or technological innovation that impacts communities, cultures, and societies

835332E0DFE601311C3168A86D17958E.description: describe and discuss examples of how people use science and technology

8352E610DFE601311C3068A86D17958E.description: Students, through the inquiry process, understand how scientific knowledge and technological developments impact communities, cultures and societies.

83528DF0DFE601311C2F68A86D17958E.description: identify technology and methods used for space exploration (e.g. star parties, space shuttles, telescopes)

83522100DFE601311C2E68A86D17958E.description: identify objects (e.g., moon, stars, meteors) in the sky and their patterns of movement and explain that light and heat comes from a star called the sun

8351DDF0DFE601311C2D68A86D17958E.description: identify seasons and explain the difference between weather and climate

83519FE0DFE601311C2C68A86D17958E.description: observe and describe the water cycle and the local weather and demonstrate how weather conditions are measured

83515E50DFE601311C2B68A86D17958E.description: investigate fossils and make inferences about life the plants, animals, and the environment at that time

83511F10DFE601311C2A68A86D17958E.description: describe and measure the physical properties of earth's basic materials (including soil, rocks, water and gases) and the resources they provide

8350DDD0DFE601311C2968A86D17958E.description: describe and give examples of earth's changing features

83509380DFE601311C2868A86D17958E.description: Students, through the inquiry process, demonstrate knowledge of the composition, structures, processes and interactions of Earth's systems and other objects in space.

83502AE0DFE601311C2768A86D17958E.description: create and use a classification system to group a variety of plants and animals according to their similarities and differences

834FCCA0DFE601311C2668A86D17958E.description: explain cause and effect relationships between nonliving and living components within ecosystems; and explain individual response to the changes in the environment including identifying differences between inherited, instinctual, and learned behaviors

834F8AD0DFE601311C2568A86D17958E.description: describe and use models that trace the life cycles of different plants and animals and discuss how they differ from species to species

834F4770DFE601311C2468A86D17958E.description: identify, measure, and describe basic requirements of energy and nutritional needs for an organism.

834F0940DFE601311C2368A86D17958E.description: identify that plants and animals have structures and systems that serve different functions for growth, survival, and reproduction

834EC940DFE601311C2268A86D17958E.description: Students, through the inquiry process, demonstrate knowledge of characteristics, structures and function of living things, the process and diversity of life, and how living organisms interact with each other and their environment.

834E7160DFE601311C2168A86D17958E.description: observe, measure and manipulate forms of energy: sound, light, heat, electrical, magnetic

834E35C0DFE601311C2068A86D17958E.description: identify, build, and describe mechanical systems and the forces acting within those systems

834DF9A0DFE601311C1F68A86D17958E.description: identify that the position of an object can be described by its location relative to another object and its motions described, and measured by external forces action upon it

834DBEF0DFE601311C1E68A86D17958E.description: model and explain that matter exists as solids, liquids, and gases and can change from one form to another

834D8410DFE601311C1D68A86D17958E.description: identify the basic characteristics of light, heat, motion, magnetism, electricity and sound

834D4860DFE601311C1C68A86D17958E.description: examine, measure, describe, compare and classify objects in terms of common physical properties

834D0A40DFE601311C1B68A86D17958E.description: create mixtures and separate them based on different physical properties (e.g., salt and sand, iron filings and soil, oil and water)

834CCA60DFE601311C1A68A86D17958E.description: Students, through the inquiry process, demonstrate knowledge of properties, forms, changes and interactions of physical and chemical systems.

834C8010DFE601311C1968A86D17958E.description: identify how observations of nature form an essential base of knowledge among the Montana American Indians

834C4110DFE601311C1868A86D17958E.description: identify a valid test in an investigation

834C0000DFE601311C1768A86D17958E.description: use models that illustrate simple concepts and compare those models to the actual phenomenon

834BBEC0DFE601311C1668A86D17958E.description: use data to describe and communicate the results of scientific investigations

834B7F80DFE601311C1568A86D17958E.description: select and use appropriate tools including technology to make measurements (including metric units) and represent results of basic scientific investigations

834B3CA0DFE601311C1468A86D17958E.description: develop the abilities necessary to safely conduct scientific inquiry, including (a step-by-step sequence is not implied): (a) asking questions about objects, events, and organisms in the environment, (b) planning and conducting simple investigations

834AEE60DFE601311C1368A86D17958E.description: Students, through the inquiry process, demonstrate the ability to design, conduct, evaluate, and communicate results and reasonable conclusions of scientific investigations.
